title: Bank Deposit Box

properties.name: description
properties.value: A bank deposit box allows players to deposit items directly into the bank from their inventory without having to open the bank interface. Unlike bankers, bank booths, or bank chests, deposit boxes are one-click and do not require entering a bank PIN, allowing for faster depositing times when skilling or resource gathering; however, they cannot be used to withdraw items or check the contents of a player's bank account. Bank deposit boxes can be found in most bank buildings and in a few other areas.

SMW Subobject for LightObject ID: 26254, 25937, 31726Uses infobox: SceneryImage: File:Bank Deposit Box (Light).pngIs variant of: Bank Deposit Box

A bank deposit box allows players to deposit items directly into the bank from their inventory without having to open the bank interface. Unlike bankers, bank booths, or bank chests, deposit boxes are one-click and do not require entering a bank PIN, allowing for faster depositing times when skilling or resource gathering; however, they cannot be used to withdraw items or check the contents of a player's bank account. Bank deposit boxes can be found in most bank buildings and in a few other areas.

A player using a bank deposit box.

To use the deposit box, players simply click the box to open up the bank deposit box window, which shows the items in the player's inventory. They can then deposit items by clicking on them, or deposit more than one by right-clicking the item. They can also deposit their entire inventory, worn equipment, or the contents of their looting bag (if they have one) by using the buttons at the bottom of the window.

Players can also quickly deposit items into the deposit box simply by using the item directly on it. If the player has more than one of the item in their inventory, the player will be prompted to select or enter the number of items they want to deposit, otherwise the single item will be deposited immediately.

NPCs[edit | edit source]

NPC Location Members Notes Maplink
Dwarven Ferryman near the Arzinian Mine in Keldagrim 1
 Banks gold ore for a 20% commission (10% if wearing ring of charos (a)). Maplink
Peer the Seer in Rellekka 1
 Requires completion of the Easy Fremennik Diary. Maplink
Rionasta in Tai Bwo Wannai 1
 Banks items at a fee of 10 trading sticks each (with the exception of any form of currency). Maplink

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
24 September 2015
(update)

Using ESC to close interfaces now functions with the rune pouch and bank deposit box interfaces.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

There is now a bank deposit box in the Crafting Guild, which can be used if you have completed the Falador Hard Diary.

22 January 2015
(update | poll)

Deposit-all buttons for your inventory, worn items and looting bag have been added to bank deposit boxes.

A '''bank deposit box''' allows players to deposit items directly into the [[bank]] from their inventory without having to open the bank interface. Unlike [[banker]]s, [[bank booth]]s, or [[bank chest]]s, deposit boxes are one-click and do not require entering a [[bank PIN]], allowing for faster depositing times when [[skill]]ing or [[Resources|resource]] gathering; however, they cannot be used to withdraw items or check the contents of a player's bank account. Bank deposit boxes can be found in most bank buildings and in a few other areas.

[[File:Bank_deposit.gif|thumb|A player using a bank deposit box.]]
To use the deposit box, players simply click the box to open up the bank deposit box window, which shows the items in the player's inventory. They can then deposit items by clicking on them, or deposit more than one by right-clicking the item. They can also deposit their entire [[inventory]], [[Worn Equipment|worn equipment]], or the contents of their [[looting bag]] (if they have one) by using the buttons at the bottom of the window.

Players can also quickly deposit items into the deposit box simply by using the item directly on it. If the player has more than one of the item in their inventory, the player will be prompted to select or enter the number of items they want to deposit, otherwise the single item will be deposited immediately.

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 24 September 2015
|update = New Animations & Barbarian Assault Changes
|change = Using ESC to close interfaces now functions with the rune pouch and bank deposit box interfaces.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 5 March 2015
|update = Achievement Diaries
|poll = Old School Achievement Diary Rewards Poll
|change = There is now a bank deposit box in the [[Crafting Guild]], which can be used if you have completed the [[Falador Hard Diary]].
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 22 January 2015
|update = Zulrah, Bank Space & More
|poll = Old_School_Content_Poll_29:_Grand_Exchange
|change = Deposit-all buttons for your inventory, worn items and looting bag have been added to bank deposit boxes.
}} 
{{Subject changes footer}}
